{{velocity}} {{html wiki="true"}} You can define any number of logical mailing-lists you want. A mailing-list matches a pattern against mails address fields (from/to/cc), and results in corresponding Tag(s) being assigned to the Mail and Topic pages. This is useful as tags then will appear in the livetable tagcloud for easy filtering, but also in statistics pages... Mailing-lists are defined independently from mail servers above, so the same mailing-list definition can be matched against mails from any server configured. #set($xwql = "from doc.object(MailArchiveCode.MailingListClass) as list where doc.space='MailArchivePrefs'") #set($count = $services.query.xwql($xwql).execute().size()) #if ($count == 0) {{warning}}<< no mailing-lists defined, please add at least one mailing-list configuration>>{{/warning}} #else #set($collist = [ "displayname", "pattern", "Tag", "color", "listId", "_actions"]) #set($colprops = { "displayname" : { "type" : "text", "link" : "view" }, "pattern" : { "type" : "text" }, "Tag" : { "type" : "text" }, "color" : { "type" : "text", "html" : "true" }, "listId" : { "type" : "text" }, "_actions" : {"actions": ["edit","delete"] } } ) #set($options = { "className":"MailArchiveCode.MailingListClass", "resultPage":"MailArchiveCode.LiveTableResults", "selectedColumn":"displayname", "tagCloud":"false", "defaultOrder":"asc", "translationPrefix" : "mailarchive.lists.table.headers.", "rowCount": 10, "extraParams" : "&space=MailArchivePrefs" }) #livetable("livetable_lists" $collist $colprops $options) #end
